Reshape CI between wide/long formats

Source: R/reshape_ci.R
reshape_ci.Rd

Reshape CI between wide/long formats.

reshape_ci(x)

Arguments

x

A data.frame containing CI_low and CI_high.

Examples

library(bayestestR)

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- ci(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89 CI_high_89 CI_low_95 CI_high_95
#> 1        X1 -1.1062518  0.9899874 -1.719033   1.525725 -2.350563   1.822851
#> 2        X2 -0.9022128  1.0479715 -1.460733   1.650602 -1.783010   1.823165
#> 3        X3 -1.1826400  0.8449893 -1.708842   1.505683 -1.951866   1.967021
#> 4        X4 -0.7739807  1.1640720 -1.572730   1.554147 -1.891857   1.852044
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter CI     CI_low   CI_high
#> 1         X1 68 -1.1062518 0.9899874
#> 2         X1 89 -1.7190329 1.5257249
#> 3         X1 95 -2.3505631 1.8228514
#> 4         X2 68 -0.9022128 1.0479715
#> 5         X2 89 -1.4607329 1.6506016
#> 6         X2 95 -1.7830098 1.8231645
#> 7         X3 68 -1.1826400 0.8449893
#> 8         X3 89 -1.7088424 1.5056831
#> 9         X3 95 -1.9518660 1.9670215
#> 10        X4 68 -0.7739807 1.1640720
#> 11        X4 89 -1.5727298 1.5541469
#> 12        X4 95 -1.8918566 1.8520440

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- describe_posterior(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter      Median  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89 CI_high_89 CI_low_95
#> 1        X1 -0.06577877 -0.7425096  1.1648182 -1.858228   1.164818 -1.924930
#> 2        X2 -0.08656972 -0.8000863  0.8441084 -1.592174   1.411237 -1.953126
#> 3        X3  0.12976621 -0.6957684  1.0632074 -1.232660   1.574911 -2.125830
#> 4        X4 -0.12407888 -0.8495421  1.1073997 -2.218091   1.311832 -2.179683
#>   CI_high_95   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1   2.114534 0.54      89     -0.1       0.1      0.13333333
#> 2   1.937195 0.53      89     -0.1       0.1      0.10000000
#> 3   1.624958 0.56      89     -0.1       0.1      0.07777778
#> 4   2.189340 0.55      89     -0.1       0.1      0.10000000
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter      Median CI     CI_low   CI_high   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low
#> 1         X1 -0.06577877 68 -0.7425096 1.1648182 0.54      89     -0.1
#> 2         X1 -0.06577877 89 -1.8582277 1.1648182 0.54      89     -0.1
#> 3         X1 -0.06577877 95 -1.9249297 2.1145335 0.54      89     -0.1
#> 4         X2 -0.08656972 68 -0.8000863 0.8441084 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 5         X2 -0.08656972 89 -1.5921735 1.4112375 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 6         X2 -0.08656972 95 -1.9531261 1.9371952 0.53      89     -0.1
#> 7         X3  0.12976621 68 -0.6957684 1.0632074 0.56      89     -0.1
#> 8         X3  0.12976621 89 -1.2326598 1.5749108 0.56      89     -0.1
#> 9         X3  0.12976621 95 -2.1258297 1.6249579 0.56      89     -0.1
#> 10        X4 -0.12407888 68 -0.8495421 1.1073997 0.55      89     -0.1
#> 11        X4 -0.12407888 89 -2.2180913 1.3118316 0.55      89     -0.1
#> 12        X4 -0.12407888 95 -2.1796833 2.1893396 0.55      89     -0.1
#>    ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1        0.1      0.13333333
#> 2        0.1      0.13333333
#> 3        0.1      0.13333333
#> 4        0.1      0.10000000
#> 5        0.1      0.10000000
#> 6        0.1      0.10000000
#> 7        0.1      0.07777778
#> 8        0.1      0.07777778
#> 9        0.1      0.07777778
#> 10       0.1      0.10000000
#> 11       0.1      0.10000000
#> 12       0.1      0.10000000
